intro: Navarretia densifolia, commonly known as the denseflower sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and small, clustered flowers. The species belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
